alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 12:44PM PDT until May 07 at 5:52PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Methow River near Pateros affecting Okanogan County. .Heavy rain and snowmelt are causing flooding on the Methow River near Pateros. Fast moving and rising river and creeks will continue through the weekend and into next week. For the Methow River...including Pateros...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Methow River near Pateros. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of adjacent roads and low-lying areas is likely throughout the Methow Valley from Mazama to Pateros. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PDT Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM PDT Friday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.6 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning and gradually decrease through next week. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 06/17/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM PDT.
